input:

11:23 Caption: Hakan Calhanoglu receives a sweet cross inside the box from Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen), but one of the defenders rushes in bravely to intercept the ball.
11:30 Caption: Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) delivers a lovely cross into the penalty area. Nevertheless, an opposition defender is alert and averts the danger with a brilliant clearance. Now Bayer Leverkusen have a corner.

13:14 Caption: Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the bottom right corner that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.

15:52 Event: Foul by Bayer Leverkusen

18:51 Event: Ball out of play

19:29 Event: Clearance by Atl.
19:33 Event: Foul by Bayer Leverkusen

20:11 Event: Ball out of play

25:20 Caption: Saul (Atl. Madrid) seems to be alright and is okay to carry on.

26:24 Caption: Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and shoots. His poorly placed shot flies well wide of the right post.

28:27 Event: Shots off target by Atl.

28:51 Event: Clearance by Bayer Leverkusen

30:13 Event: Ball out of play

30:43 Caption: Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) decides to speed play up with a short corner kick.
30:50 Event: Corner by Bayer Leverkusen

31:15 Caption: Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) crosses into the box from near the side line, but he doesn't connect as he wanted and it's cleared by the well-organized defence.
31:33 Caption: Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) didn't hesitate to knock his opponent down with a harsh sliding tackle. Pavel Kralovec could probably show him a yellow, but he only goes with blowing the whistle for a foul. A free kick to Atl. Madrid.
32:04 Event: Indirect free-kick by Atl.
32:32 Event: Foul by Bayer Leverkusen

32:52 Event: Indirect free-kick by Atl.

34:12 Event: Indirect free-kick by Atl.
34:40 Event: Foul by Bayer Leverkusen

44:29 Event: Indirect free-kick by Atl.
44:33 Event: Ball out of play
44:45 Event: Throw-in by Atl.
45:06 Caption: Atl. Madrid concede a free kick following a bad challenge.
45:19 Caption: Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him. The ball goes out of play. Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a corner kick.
46:09 Caption: The resulting corner comes to nothing as Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) sends it out of play. Bayer Leverkusen force their opponents to concede a corner.
46:42 Caption: The corner from Hakan Calhanoglu (Bayer Leverkusen) is hurriedly cleared.
47:13 Caption: Mario Mandzukic (Atl. Madrid) produces an attempt from the edge of the box which would have most likely endangered the goalkeeper, but one of the defending players blocked it, so we can only speculate about the outcome. The ball goes out for a corner. Atl. Madrid can continue in their attacking effort.
47:22 Caption: Gabi (Atl. Madrid) whips in a cross from the corner, but Bernd Leno is well positioned and punches the ball away.
47:45 Caption: Tiago (Atl. Madrid) makes a yard for himself as he picks up the rebound after chaos in the box and quickly sends a shot towards the right post. The goalkeeper pulls off a remarkable save to keep the ball out. What a save!
48:18 Caption: The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
48:59 Caption: There was plenty of entertainment during the first 45 minutes. Hopefully more of the same in the second half. Neither team has really been able to control the flow of the game. The home team are trying to prevail using combination football, unlike the away side who are attempting to create scoring opportunities mostly with long balls.

Second Half:

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
The match between Bayer Leverkusen and Atlético Madrid started off on a cautious note, with both teams evidently trying to ease into the game. Atlético Madrid got things underway with the kick-off, but the initial few minutes were mostly characterized by throw-ins and clearances. Bayer Leverkusen appeared slightly more aggressive in the initial 10 minutes, pressing forward and attempting to disrupt Atlético's gameplay.

At 11 minutes into the game, Bayer Leverkusen had their first real opportunity when Heung-Min Son delivered a sweet cross into the box, which Hakan Calhanoglu attempted to convert. However, Atlético's defense was vigilant, managing to intercept the ball. Just moments later, Calhanoglu sent another lovely cross into the penalty area, but once again, the visitors' defense cleared it brilliantly, resulting in a corner for Bayer Leverkusen. Calhanoglu took the corner but overhit it, and none of his teammates could capitalize on it.

A significant moment came at the 13-minute mark when Emir Spahic unleashed a quick strike towards the bottom right corner inside the penalty area. Despite beating the goalkeeper, one of the Atlético defenders performed a crucial goal-line clearance, denying Bayer Leverkusen the opening goal. This raised the intensity on the field, and Bayer Leverkusen continued to apply pressure with successive throw-ins and crosses, but Atlético's defense held firm.

At around the 15th minute, Josip Drmić of Bayer Leverkusen was first to the rebound and sent a goalward header, which was blocked, creating a significant escape for Atlético. Shortly after, Gonzalo Castro’s sliding tackle on an opponent drew the referee's attention, resulting in a caution but no card.

The game saw its first booking at the 22nd minute when Tiago of Atlético Madrid was cautioned for a foul committed earlier. The match then paused briefly when Saul of Atlético picked up a knock, necessitating the physio's intrusion to check on him. Bayer Leverkusen continued to dominate possession. Hakan Calhanoglu expertly delivered a long pass to Heung-Min Son, who advanced menacingly before Emir Spahic unleashed a long-range shot that rattled the crossbar. This momentum kept the home fans on their toes.

Atlético's attack could not stay idle as they responded with attempts of their own. Antoine Griezmann floated in crosses, and Diego Godin attempted a shot from the edge but failed to slice through Bayer Leverkusen’s well-guarded lines. The halftime saw multiple interruptions with various fouls and free-kicks managed by both teams but no significant threats materialized. The referee issued a yellow card to Bayer Leverkusen’s Kyriakos Papadopoulos for a foul, indicating a firm stance to control the match's physicality.

Towards the end of the first half, the match saw a substitution for Atlético as Guilherme Siqueira had to depart due to injury and was replaced by Jesus Gamez. The latter part of the half was more about containment and securing a foothold in the game than a flamboyant attacking display. Despite myriad efforts and considerable midfield battles, the first half ended goalless.

As the second half commenced, Atlético Madrid tried to regain possession and control. The home side, Bayer Leverkusen, maintained their aggressive stance. Emir Spahic drew an early foul, presenting Atlético with an opportunity from a set piece, but Gabi’s effort was comfortably dealt with by the keeper. The match's physical nature continued with multiple fouls occurring in quick succession.

A breakthrough finally came in the 11th minute of the second half when Bayer Leverkusen's Karim Bellarabi displayed great vision, sending a precise pass to Calhanoglu. Calhanoglu showcased brilliant composure inside the box to slot the ball into the top of the net, giving Bayer Leverkusen the much-needed opening goal and putting them ahead by 1-0.

The goal added to the match's intensity, and Atlético Madrid, now trailing, sought to reply immediately. However, Bayer Leverkusen managed to control the flow of the game well, transitioning between compact defense and rapid counter-attacks. The physicality on both ends did not cease with Diego Godin being booked for a late tackle. The game constantly saw interruptions for fouls and consequent free-kicks, highlighting the aggressive nature both teams had adopted.

A significant substitution came from Atlético’s side at the 18th minute with Fernando Torres replacing Arda Turan, signaling Simeone's intent to add more firepower upfront. Bayer Leverkusen also made a tactical change, introducing Simon Rolfes for Lars Bender, maintaining a balance between their offensive thirst and defensive caution.

Leverkusen's defense continued to thwart Atlético's attacking moves, with Bernd Leno showcasing a stellar performance. A cross delivered by Fernando Torres found Raul Garcia, but Garcia's effort was well-executed by Bayer Leverkusen's vigilant defense, keeping the visitors at bay.

Midway through the second half, the flow of the game saw Atlético pushing more aggressively for the equalizer. Fernando Torres impressed with his pace and movement but couldn’t find the net due to Leno’s excellent saves. In the 27th minute, Bayer Leverkusen went close again, but the goalkeeper Miguel Angel Moya matched the situation with fine reflexes, keeping his side within a striking distance.

In the 30th minute mark, Tiago of Atlético Madrid received a second booking, resulting in a red card and reducing Atlético to ten men for the remainder of the match. This left Atlético with a massive tactical disadvantage, altering their game dynamics significantly.

Kyriakos Papadopoulos came close with a shot towards the bottom left corner, which was phenomenally saved by Moya. As the match progressed towards its final stages, the home side, Bayer Leverkusen, employed a strategy aiming to manage the clock and maintain possession efficiently to secure their lead. However, Atlético Madrid, despite being a man down, showcased relentless spirit, endeavoring to break through Bayer Leverkusen’s disciplined defense.

The final moments saw more substitutions, with Stefan Kiessling replacing Josip Drmic, and Julian Brandt coming on for Calhanoglu, symbolically marking an effort to reinforce the defense while maintaining fresh legs on the pitch for counterattacks. A few exchanges of aggressive challenges were noted in the last minutes, resulting in additional bookings for players like Gonzalo Castro of Bayer Leverkusen.

As the referee called time on the match, Bayer Leverkusen emerged victorious with a narrow but significant 1-0 win. The match's overall narrative highlighted Bayer Leverkusen’s resilient defense, strategic gameplay, and a touch of brilliance that came in the form of Calhanoglu’s decisive goal. On the other hand, Atlético Madrid showcased firm resolve and fighting spirit but were eventually undone due to the combination of disciplinary lapses and high-caliber goalkeeping from Bernd Leno.

The victorious home side’s tactical approach of combination football paid dividends, while Atlético’s attempts through long balls fell short. This match was a testimony to Bayer Leverkusen's diligent gameplay and courage under consistent pressure, ensuring a celebrated win for the home fans in attendance.
